movie.info: Star Wars: A New Hope Writers : George Lucas Genres : Action Adventure Fantasy Sci-Fi
movie.beginning:
STAR WARS
Episode IV
A NEW HOPE
From the JOURNAL OF THE WHILLS
by George Lucas
Revised Fourth Draft January 15, 1976
LUCASFILM LTD.
A long time ago, in a galaxy far, far, away...
A vast sea of stars serves as the backdrop for the main title. War drums echo through the heavens as a rollup slowly crawls into infinity.
It is a period of civil war. Rebel spaceships, striking from a hidden base, have won their first victory against the evil Galactic Empire.
During the battle, Rebel spies managed to steal secret plans to the Empire's ultimate weapon, the Death Star, an armored space station with enough power to destroy an entire planet.
Pursued by the Empire's sinister agents, Princess Leia races home aboard her starship, custodian of the stolen plans that can save her people and restore freedom to the galaxy...
The awesome yellow planet of Tatooine emerges from a total eclipse, her two moons glowing against the darkness. A tiny silver spacecraft, a Rebel Blockade Runner firing lasers from the back of the ship, races through space. It is pursed by a giant Imperial Stardestroyer. Hundreds of deadly laserbolts streak from the Imperial Stardestroyer, causing the main solar fin of the Rebel craft to disintegrate.

scene.sceneheader: INT. REBEL BLOCKADE RUNNER - MAIN PASSAGEWAY

meta.s: An explosion rocks the ship as two robots, Artoo-Detoo (R2- D2) and See-Threepio (C-3PO) struggle to make their way through the shaking, bouncing passageway.
Both robots are old and battered.
Artoo is a short, claw-armed tripod.
His face is a mass of computer lights surrounding a radar eye.
Threepio, on the other hand, is a tall, slender robot of human proportions.
He has a gleaming bronze-like metallic surface of an Art Deco design.
Another blast shakes them as they struggle along their way.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: They've shut down the main reactor.

meta.s: Rebel troopers rush past the robots and take up positions in the main passageway.
They aim their weapons toward the door.
The little R2 unit makes a series of electronic sounds that only another robot could understand.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: There'll be no escape for the Princess this time.

meta.s: Artoo continues making beeping sounds.
Tension mounts as loud metallic latches clank and the scream of heavy equipment are heard moving around the outside hull of the ship.
The Imperial craft has easily overtaken the Rebel Blockade Runner.
The smaller Rebel ship is being drawn into the underside dock of the giant Imperial starship.
The nervous Rebel troopers aim their weapons.
Suddenly a tremendous blast opens up a hole in the main passageway and a score of fearsome armored spacesuited stormtroopers make their way into the smoke-filled corridor.
In a few minutes the entire passageway is ablaze with laserfire.
The deadly bolts ricochet in wild random patterns creating huge explosions.
Stormtroopers scatter and duck behind storage lockers.
Laserbolts hit several Rebel soldiers who scream and stagger through the smoke, holding shattered arms and faces.
An explosion hits near the robots.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: I should have known better than to trust the logic of a half-sized thermocapsulary dehousing assister...

meta.s: Artoo counters with an angry rebuttal as the battle rages around the two hapless robots.
A death-white wasteland stretches from horizon to horizon.
The tremendous heat of two huge twin suns settle on a lone figure, Luke Skywalker, a farm boy with heroic aspirations who looks much younger than his eighteen years.
His shaggy hair and baggy tunic give him the air of a simple but lovable lad with a prize-winning smile.
A light wind whips at him as he adjusts several valves on a large battered moisture vaporator which sticks out of the desert floor much like an oil pipe with valves.
He is aided by a beatup tread-robot with six claw arms.
The little robot appears to be barely functioning and moves with jerky motions.
A bright sparkle in the morning sky catches Luke's eye and he instinctively grabs a pair of electrobinoculars from his utility belt.

He stands transfixed for a few moments studying the heavens, then dashed toward his dented, crudely repaired Landspeeder (an auto-like transport that travels a few feet above the ground on a magnetic-field).
He motions for the tiny robot to follow him.
The robot scoots around in a tight circle, stops short, and smoke begins to pour out of every joint.
Luke throws his arms up in disgust.
Exasperated, the young farm boy jumps into his Landspeeder leaving the smoldering robot to hum madly.

scene.sceneheader: INT. REBEL BLOCKADE RUNNER - MAIN HALLWAY

meta.s: The awesome, seven-foot-tall Dark Lord of the Sith makes his way into the blinding light of the main passageway.
This is Darth Vader, right hand of the Emperor.
His face is obscured by his flowing black robes and grotesque breath mask, which stands out next to the fascist white armored suits of the Imperial stormtroopers.
Everyone instinctively backs away from the imposing warrior and a deathly quiet sweeps through the Rebel troops.
Several of the Rebel troops break and run in a frenzied panic.
A woman's hand puts a card into an opening in Artoo's dome.
Artoo makes beeping sounds.
Threepio stands in a hallway, somewhat bewildered.
Artoo is nowhere in sight.
The pitiful screams of the doomed Rebel soldiers can be heard in the distance.
A familiar clanking sound attacks Threepio's attention and he spots little Artoo at the end of the hallway in a smoke- filled alcove.
A beautiful young girl (about sixteen years old) stands in front of Artoo.
Surreal and out of place, dreamlike and half hidden in the smoke, she finishes adjusting something on Artoo's computer face, then watches as the little robot joins his companion.
Stormtroopers can be heard battling in the distance.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: What are we going to do?
We'll be sent to the spice mine of Kessel or smashed into who knows what!

meta.s: Artoo scoots past his bronze friend and races down the subhallway.
Threepio chases after him.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: Wait a minute, where are you going?

meta.s: Artoo responds with electronic beeps.
The evil Darth Vader stands amid the broken and twisted bodies of his foes.
He grabs a wounded Rebel Officer by the neck as an Imperial Officer rushes up to the Dark Lord.

dialogue.name: IMPERIAL OFFICER
dialogue.s: The Death Star plans are not in the main computer.

meta.s: Vader squeezes the neck of the Rebel Officer, who struggles in vain.

dialogue.name: VADER
dialogue.s: Where are those transmissions you intercepted?

meta.s: Vader lifts the Rebel off his feet by his throat.

dialogue.name: VADER
dialogue.s: What have you done with those plans?

dialogue.name: VADER
dialogue.s: If this is a consular ship... were is the Ambassador?

meta.s: The Rebel refuses to speak but eventually cries out as the Dark Lord begins to squeeze the officer's throat, creating a gruesome snapping and choking, until the soldier goes limp.
Vader tosses the dead soldier against the wall and turns to his troops.

dialogue.name: VADER
dialogue.s: Commander, tear this ship apart until you've found those plans and bring me the Ambassador.

meta.s: The stormtroopers scurry into the subhallways.
The lovely young girl huddles in a small alcove as the stormtroopers search through the ship.
She is Princess Leia Organa, a member of the Alderaan Senate.
The fear in her eyes slowly gives way to anger as the muted crushing sounds of the approaching stormtroopers grow louder.
One of the troopers spots her.
Leia steps from her hiding place and blasts a trooper with her laser pistol.
She starts to run but is felled by a paralyzing ray.
The troopers inspect her inert body.

dialogue.name: TROOPER
dialogue.s: Inform Lord Vader we have a prisoner.

meta.s: Artoo stops before the small hatch of an emergency lifepod.
He snaps the seal on the main latch and a red warning light begins to flash.
The stubby astro-robot works his way into the cramped four-man pod.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: Hey, you're not permitted in there.

meta.s: Artoo beeps something to him.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: Don't call me a mindless philosopher, you overweight glob of grease!
Now come out before somebody sees you.

meta.s: Artoo whistles something at his reluctant friend regarding the mission he is about to perform.
Artoo isn't happy with Threepio's stubbornness, and he beeps and twangs angrily.
A new explosion, this time very close, sends dust and debris through the narrow subhallway.
Flames lick at Threepio and, after a flurry of electronic swearing from Artoo, the lanky robot jumps into the lifepod.
On the main viewscreen, the lifepod carrying the two terrified robots speeds away from the stricken Rebel spacecraft.

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN
dialogue.s: It must have been short- circuited.

meta.s: Artoo and Threepio look out at the receding Imperial starship.
Stars circle as the pod rotates through the galaxy.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: That's funny, the damage doesn't look as bad from out here.

meta.s: Artoo beeps an assuring response.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: Are you sure this things safe?

scene.sceneheader: EXT. TATOOINE - ANCHORHEAD SETTLEMENT - POWER STATION - DAY

meta.s: Heat waves radiate from the dozen or so bleached white buildings.
Luke pilots his Landspeeder through the dusty empty street of the tiny settlement.
An old woman runs to get out of the way of the speeding vehicle, shaking her fist at Luke as he flies past.

dialogue.name: WOMAN
dialogue.s: I've told you kids to slow down!

meta.s: Luke bursts into the power station, waking The Fixer, a rugged mechanic and Camie, a sexy, disheveled girl who has been asleep in his lap.
They grumbled as he races through the office, yelling wildly.

dialogue.name: FIXER
dialogue.s: Did I hear a young noise blast through here?

dialogue.name: CAMIE
dialogue.s: It was just wormie on another rampage.

meta.s: Luke bounces into a small room behind the office where Deak and Windy, two tough boys about the same age as Luke, are playing a computer pool-like game with Biggs, a burly, handsome boy a few years older than the rest.
His flashy city attire is a sharp contrast to the loose-fitting tunics of the farm boys.
A robot repairs some equipment in the background.
Luke's surprise at the appearance of Biggs gives way to great joy and emotion.
They give each other a great bear hug.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: I didn't know you were back!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.s: I wanted to surprise you, hot shot.
I thought you'd be here... certainly didn't expect you to be out working.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: The Academy didn't change you much...but you're back so soon?
Hey, what happened, didn't you get your commission?

meta.s: Biggs has an air of cool that seems slightly phony.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.s: Signed aboard The Rand Ecliptic last week.
First mate Biggs Darklighter at your service... (he salutes) ...I just came to say good-bye to all you unfortunate landlocked simpletons.

meta.s: Everyone laughs.
The dazzling spectacle of his dashing friend is almost too much for Luke, but suddenly he snaps out of it.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. TATOOINE - ANCHORHEAD - SETTLEMENT - POWER STATION -

meta.s: The group stumbles out into the stifling desert sun.
Camie and The Fixer complain and are forced to shade their eyes.
Luke has his binoculars out scanning the heavens.
Biggs takes the binoculars from Luke as the others strain to see something with the naked eye.
Through the binoculars Biggs sees two small silver specks.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.s: That's no battle, hot shot... they're just sitting there!

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: But there was a lot of firing earlier...

meta.s: Camie grabs the binoculars away banging them against the building in the process.
Luke grabs them.
The Fixer gives Luke a hard look and the young farm boy shrugs his shoulders in resignation.

dialogue.name: FIXER
dialogue.s: I keep telling you, the Rebellion is a long way from here.
I doubt if the Empire would even fight to keep this system.
Believe me Luke, this planet is a big hunk of nothing...

meta.s: Luke agrees, although it's obvious he isn't sure why.
The group stumbles back into the power station, grumbling about Luke's ineptitude.
Princess Leia is led down a low-ceilinged hallway by a squad of armored stormtroopers.
Her hands are bound and she is brutally shoved when she is unable to keep up with the briskly marching troops.
They stop in a smoky hallway as Darth Vader emerges from the shadows.
The sinister Dark Lord stares hard at the frail young senator, but she doesn't move.

dialogue.name: LEIA
dialogue.s: Lord Vader, I should have known.
Only you could be so bold.
The Imperial Senate will not sit for this, when they hear you've attacked a diplomatic...

dialogue.name: VADER
dialogue.s: Don't play games with me, Your Highness.
You weren't on any mercy mission this time.
You passed directly through a restricted system.
Several transmissions were beamed to this ship by Rebel spies.
I want to know what happened to the plans they sent you.

dialogue.name: LEIA
dialogue.s: I don't know what you're talking about.
I'm a member of the Imperial Senate on a diplomatic mission to Alderaan...

dialogue.name: VADER
dialogue.s: You're a part of the Rebel Alliance... and a traitor.

meta.s: Leia is marched away down the hallway and into the smoldering hole blasted in the side of the ship.
An Imperial Commander turns to Vader.

dialogue.name: COMMANDER
dialogue.s: If word of this gets out, it could generate sympathy for the Rebellion in the senate.

dialogue.name: VADER
dialogue.s: I have traced the Rebel spies to her.
Now she is my only link to find their secret base!

dialogue.name: COMMANDER
dialogue.s: She'll die before she tells you anything.

dialogue.name: VADER
dialogue.s: Send a distress signal and then inform the senate that all aboard were killed!

meta.s: Another Imperial Officer approaches Vader and the Commander.
They stop and snap to attention.

dialogue.name: SECOND OFFICER
dialogue.s: Lord Vader, the battle station plans are not aboard this ship!
An escape pod was jettisoned during the fighting, but no life forms were aboard.

meta.s: Vader turns to the Commander.

dialogue.name: VADER
dialogue.s: She must have hidden the plans in the escape pod.
Send a detachment down to retrieve them.
There'll be no one to stop us this time.

meta.s: The Imperial Stardestroyer comes over the surface of the planet Tatooine.
Jundland, or "No Man's Land", where the rugged desert mesas meet the foreboding dune sea.
The two helpless astro-droids kick up clouds of sand as they leave the lifepod and clumsily work their way across the desert wasteland.
The lifepod in the distance rests half buried in the sand.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: How did I get into this mess?
We seem to be made to suffer.

meta.s: Artoo answers with beeping sounds.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: I've got to rest before I fall apart.

meta.s: Artoo continues to respond with beeping sounds.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: What a desolate place this is.

meta.s: Suddenly Artoo whistles, makes a sharp right turn and starts off in the direction of the rocky desert mesas.
Threepio stops and yells at him.
A stream of electronic noises pours forth from the small robot.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: Well, I'm not going that way.

meta.s: Artoo counters with a long whistle.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: What makes you think there are settlements over there?

meta.s: Artoo continues to make beeping sounds.
Artoo continues to make beeping sounds.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: I've had just about enough of you!
You'll be malfunctioning within a day, you nearsighted scrap pile!

meta.s: Threepio gives the little robot a kick and starts off in the direction of the vast dune sea.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: And don't let me catch you following me begging for help, because you won't get it.

meta.s: Artoo's reply is a rather rude sound.
He turns and trudges off in the direction of the towering mesas.
Artoo beeps to himself as he makes his way toward the distant mountains.
Threepio, hot and tired, struggles up over the ridge of a dune; only to find more dunes, which seem to go on for endless miles.
He looks back in the direction of the now distant rock mesas.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: He tricked me into going this way, but he'll do no better.

meta.s: In a huff of anger and frustration, Threepio knocks the sand from his joints.
His plight seems hopeless, when a glint of reflected light in the distance reveals an object moving towards him.
The bronze android waves frantically and yells at the approaching transport.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. TATOOINE - ANCHORHEAD SETTLEMENT - POWER STATION - DAY

meta.s: Luke and Biggs are walking and drinking a malt brew.
Fixer and the others can be heard working inside.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: (Very animated) ...so I cut off my power, shut down the afterburners and came in low on Deak's trail.
I was so close I thought I was going to fry my instruments.
As it was I busted up the Skyhopper pretty bad.
He grounded me for the rest of the season.
You should have been there... it was fantastic.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.s: You ought to take it easy Luke.
You may be the hottest bushpilot this side of Mos Eisley, but those little Skyhoppers are dangerous.
Keep it up, and one day, whammo, you're going to be nothing more than a dark spot on the down side of a canyon wall.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Now that you've been around those giant starships you're beginning to sound like my uncle.
You've gotten soft in the city...

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Well, things haven't been the same since you left, Biggs.

meta.s: Biggs looks around then leans close to Luke.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.s: Luke, I didn't come back just to say good-bye...
I shouldn't tell you this, but you're the only one I can trust... and if I don't come back, I want somebody to know.

meta.s: Luke's eyes are wide with Biggs' seriousness and loyalty.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.s: I made some friends at the Academy.
(he whispers) ...when our frigate goes to one of the central systems, we're going to jump ship and join the Alliance...

meta.s: Luke, amazed and stunned, is almost speechless.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.s: You got a mouth bigger than a meteor crater!

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: (he whispers) Listen how quiet I am.

meta.s: Biggs shakes his head angrily and then continues.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.s: My friend has a friend on Bestine who might help us make contact.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: You could wander around forever trying to find them.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.s: I know it's a long shot, but if I don't find them I'll do what I can on my own...
It's what we always talked about.
Luke, I'm not going to wait for the Empire to draft me into service.
The Rebellion is spreading and I want to be on the right side -- the side I believe in.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.s: I thought you were going to the Academy next term.
You'll get your chance to get off this rock.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: I had to cancel my application.
There has been a lot of unrest among the Sandpeople since you left... they've even raided the outskirts of Anchorhead.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.s: Your uncle could hold off a whole colony of Sandpeople with one blaster.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: I know, but he's got enough vaporators going to make the place pay off.
He needs me for just one more season.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.s: I feel for you, Luke, you're going to have to learn what seems to be important or what really is important.
What good is all your uncle's work if it's taken over by the Empire?...
You know they're starting to nationalize commerce in the central systems... it won't be long before your uncle is merely a tenant, slaving for the greater glory of the Empire.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: The Empire won't bother with this rock.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: I wish I was going... Are you going to be around long?

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.s: No, I'm leaving in the morning...

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Then I guess I won't see you.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Well, I'll be at the Academy next season... after that who knows.
I won't be drafted into the Imperial Starfleet that's for sure... Take care of yourself, you'll always be the best friend I've got.

meta.s: Biggs turns away from his old friend and heads towards the power station.
The gargantuan rock formations are shrouded in a strange foreboding mist and the onimous sounds of unearthly creatures fill the air.
Artoo moves cautiously through the creepy rock canyon, inadvertently making a loud clicking noise as he goes.
He hears a distant, hard, metallic sound and stops for a moment.
Convinced he is alone, he continues on his way.
In the distance, a pebble tumbles down the steep canyon wall and a small dark figure darts into the shadows.
A little further up the canyon a slight flicker of light reveals a pair of eyes in the dark recesses only a few feet from the narrow path.
The unsuspecting robot waddles along the rugged trail until suddenly, out of nowhere, a powerful magnetic ray shoots out of the rocks and engulfs him in an eerie glow.
He manages one short electronic squeak before he topples over onto his back.
His bright computer lights flicker off, then on, then off again.
Out of the rocks scurry three Jawas, no taller than Artoo.
They holster strange and complex weapons as they cautiously approach the robot.
They wear grubby cloaks and their faces are shrouded so only their glowing eyes can be seen.
They hiss and make odd guttural sounds as they heave the heavy robot onto their shoulders and carry him off down the trail.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. TATOOINE - ROCK CANYON - SANDCRAWLER - SUNSET

meta.s: The eight Jawas carry Artoo out of the canyon to a huge tank- like vehicle the size of a four-story house.
They weld a small disk on the side of Artoo and then put him under a large tube on the side of the vehicle and the little robot is sucked into the giant machine.
The filthy little Jawas scurry like rats up small ladders and enter the main cabin of the behemoth transport.
It is dim inside the hold area of the Sandcrawler.
Artoo switches on a small floodlight on his forehead and stumbles around the scrap heap.
The narrow beam swings across rusty metal rocket parts and an array of grotesquely twisted and maimed astro-robots.
He lets out a pathetic electronic whimper and stumbles off toward what appears to be a door at the end of the chamber.
Artoo enters a wide room with a four-foot ceiling.
In the middle of the scrap heap sit a dozen or so robots of various shapes and sizes.
Some are engaged in electronic conversation, while others simply mill about.
A voice of recognition calls out from the gloom.
A battered Threepio scrambles up to Artoo and embraces him.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. TATOOINE - ROCK CANYON - SANDCRAWLER - SUNSET

meta.s: The enormous Sandcrawler lumbers off toward the magnificent twin suns, which are slowly setting over a distant mountain ridge.
Four Imperial stormtroopers mill about in front of the half- buried lifepod that brought Artoo and Threepio to Tatooine.
A trooper yells to an officer some distance away.

dialogue.name: FIRST TROOPER
dialogue.s: The tracks go off in this direction.

meta.s: A second trooper picks a small bit of metal out of the sand and gives it to the first trooper.
The Sandcrawler moves slowly down a great sand dune.
Threepio and Artoo noisily bounce along inside the cramped prison chamber.
Artoo appears to be shut off.
Suddenly the shaking and bouncing of the Sandcrawler stops, creating quite a commotion among the mechanical men.
Threepio's fist bangs the head of Artoo whose computer lights pop on as he begins beeping.
At the far end of the long chamber a hatch opens, filling the chamber with blinding white light.
a dozen or so Jawas make their way through the odd assortment of robots.
A Jawa starts moving toward them.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: Do you think they'll melt us down?

meta.s: Artoo responds, making beeping sounds.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. TATOOINE - DESERT - LARS HOMESTEAD - AFTERNOON

meta.s: The Jawas mutter gibberish as they busily line up their battered captives, including Artoo and Threepio, in front of the enormous Sandcrawler, which is parked beside a small homestead consisting of three large holes in the ground surrounded by several tall moisture vaporators and one small adobe block house.
The Jawas scurry around fussing over the robots, straightening them up or brushing some dust from a dented metallic elbow.
The shrouded little creatures smell horribly, attracting small insects to the dark areas when their mouths and nostrils should be.
Out of the shadows of a dingy side-building limps Owen Lars, a large burly man in his mid-fifties.
His reddish eyes are sunken in a dust-covered face.
As the farmer carefully inspects each robot, he is closely followed by his slump- shouldered nephew, Luke Skywalker.
One of the vile little Jawas walks ahead of the farmer spouting an animated sales pitch in a queer, unintelligible language.
A voice calls out from one of the huge holes that form the homestead.
Luke goes over to the edge and sees his Aunt Beru standing in the main courtyard.

dialogue.name: BERU
dialogue.s: Luke, tell Owen that if he gets a translator to be sure it speaks Bocce.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: It looks like we don't have much of a choice but I'll remind him.

meta.s: Luke returns to his uncle as they look over the equipment for sale with the Jawa leader.

dialogue.name: OWEN
dialogue.s: I have no need for a protocol droid.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: (quickly) Sir -- not in an environment such as this -- that's why I've also been programmed for over thirty secondary functions that...

dialogue.name: OWEN
dialogue.s: What I really need is a droid that understands the binary language of moisture vaporators.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: Sir -- My first job was programming binary load lifter... very similar to your vaporators.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: It's like a second language for me...

dialogue.name: OWEN
dialogue.s: (turning to Jawa) I'll take this one.

dialogue.name: OWEN
dialogue.s: Luke, take these two over to the garage, will you?
I want you to have both of them cleaned up before dinner.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: But I was going into Toshi Station to pick up some power converters...

dialogue.name: OWEN
dialogue.s: You can waste time with your friends when your chores are done.
Now come on, get to it!

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: And the red one, come on.
Well, come on, Red, let's go.

meta.s: As the Jawas start to lead the three remaining robots back into the Sandcrawler, Artoo lets out a pathetic little beep and starts after his old friend Threepio.
He is restrained by a slimy Jawa, who zaps him with a control box.
Owen is negotiating with the head Jawa.
Luke and the two robots start off for the garage when a plate pops off the head of the red astro-droid's head plate and it sparks wildly.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: This R2 unit has a bad motivator.

dialogue.name: OWEN
dialogue.s: (to the head Jawa) Hey, what're you trying to push on us?

meta.s: The Jawa goes into a loud spiel.
Meanwhile, Artoo has sneaked out of line and is moving up and down trying to attract attention.
He lets out with a low whistle.
Threepio taps Luke on the shoulder.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: (pointing to Artoo) Excuse me, sir, but that R2 unit is in prime condition.

dialogue.name: OWEN
dialogue.s: (to Jawa) What about that blue one?

meta.s: With a little reluctance the scruffy dwarf trades the damaged astro-droid for Artoo.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: Uh, I'm quite sure you'll be very pleased with that one, sir.
He really is in first-class condition.

meta.s: Owen pays off the whining Jawa as Luke and the two robots trudge off toward a grimy homestead entry.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: (to Artoo) Now, don't you forget this!
Why I should stick my neck out for you is quite beyond my capacity!

scene.sceneheader: INT. LARS HOMESTEAD - GARAGE AREA - LATE AFTERNOON

meta.s: The garage is cluttered and worn, but a friendly peaceful atmosphere permeates the low grey chamber.
Threepio lowers himself into a large tub filled with warm oil.
Near the battered Landspeeder little Artoo rests on a large battery with a cord to his face.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: This oil bath is going to feel so good.
I've got such a bad case of dust contamination, I can barely move!

meta.s: Artoo beeps a muffled reply.
Luke seems to be lost in thought as he runs his hand over the damaged fin of a small two-man Skyhopper spaceship resting in a low hangar off the garage.
Finally Luke's frustrations get the better of him and he slams a wrench across the workbench.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: I'm never gonna get out of here!

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: Is there anything I might do to help?

meta.s: Luke glances at the battered robot.
A bit of his anger drains and a tiny smile creeps across his face.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Well, not unless you can alter time, speed up the harvest, or teleport me off this rock!

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: I'm only a droid and not very knowledgeable about such things.
As a matter of fact, I'm not even sure which planet I'm on.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Well, if there's a bright center to the universe, you're on the planet that it's farthest from.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Uh, you can call me Luke.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: And I am See-Threepio, human-cyborg relations, and this is my counterpart, Artoo-Detoo.

meta.s: Artoo beeps in response.
Luke unplugs Artoo and begins to scrape several connectors on the robot's head with a chrome pick.
Threepio climbs out of the oil tub and begins wiping oil from his bronze body.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: You got a lot of carbon scoring here.
It looks like you boys have seen a lot of action.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: With all we've been through, sometimes I'm amazed we're in as good condition as we are, what with the Rebellion and all.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: You know of the Rebellion against the Empire?

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: That's how we came to be in your service, if you take my meaning, sir.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Have you been in many battles?

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: Actually, there's not much to tell.
I'm not much more than an interpreter, and not very good at telling stories.
Well, not at making them interesting, anyways.

meta.s: Luke struggles to remove a small metal fragment from Artoo's neck joint.
He uses a larger pick.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Well, my little friend, you've got something jammed in here real good.
Were you on a cruiser or...

meta.s: The fragment breaks loose with a snap, sending Luke tumbling head over heels.
He sits up and sees a twelve-inch three- dimensional hologram of Leia Organa, the Rebel senator, being projected from the face of little Artoo.
The image is a rainbow of colors as it flickers and jiggles in the dimly lit garage.
Luke's mouth hangs open in awe.
Artoo looks around and sheepishly beeps an answer for Threepio to translate.
Leia continues to repeat the sentence fragment over and over.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: He asked you a question... (pointing to Leia) What is that?

meta.s: Artoo whistles his surprise as he pretends to just notice the hologram.
He looks around and sheepishly beeps an answer for Threepio to translate.
Leia continues to repeat the sentence fragment over and over.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: Oh, he says it's nothing, sir.

meta.s: Luke becomes intrigued by the beautiful girl.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: I'm afraid I'm not quite sure, sir.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: I think she was a passenger on our last voyage.
A person of some importance, sir -- I believe.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Is there more to this recording?

meta.s: Luke reaches out for Artoo but he lets out several frantic squeaks and a whistle.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: You're going to get us in trouble.
It's all right, you can trust him.

meta.s: Artoo whistles and beeps a long message to Threepio.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: He says he's the property of Obi-Wan Kenobi, a resident of these parts.
And it's a private message for him.
Quite frankly, sir I don't know what he's talking about.
Our last master was Captain Antilles, but with what we've been through, this little R2 unit has become a bit eccentric.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: I wonder if he means old Ben Kenobi?

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: I beg your pardon, sir, but do you know what he's talking about?

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Well, I don't know anyone named Obi- Wan, but old Ben lives out beyond the dune sea.
He's kind of a strange old hermit.

meta.s: Luke's gazes at the beautiful young princess for a few moments.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: It sounds like she's in trouble.
I'd better play back the whole thing.

meta.s: Artoo beeps something to Threepio.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: He says the restraining bolt has short circuited his recording system.
He suggests that if you remove the bolt, he might be able to play back the entire recording.

meta.s: Luke looks longingly at the lovely, little princess and hasn't really heard what Threepio has been saying.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Oh, yeah, well, I guess you're too small to run away on me if I take this off!

meta.s: Luke takes a wedged bar and pops the restraining bolt off Artoo's side.
The princess immediately disappears...
Artoo beeps an innocent reply as Threepio sits up in embarrassment.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: The one you're carrying inside your rusty innards!

meta.s: A women's voice calls out from another room.
Luke stands up and shakes his head at the malfunctioning robot.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: All right, I'll be right there, Aunt Beru.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: I'm sorry, sir, but he appears to have picked up a slight flutter.

meta.s: Luke tosses Artoo's restraining bolt on the workbench and hurries out of the room.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Well, see what you can do with him.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: (to Artoo) Just you reconsider playing that message for him.

meta.s: Artoo beeps in response.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: No, I don't think he likes you at all.

meta.s: Artoo beeps.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: No, I don't like you either.

meta.s: Luke's Aunt Beru, a warm, motherly woman, fills a pitcher with blue fluid from a refrigerated container in the well- used kitchen.
She puts the pitcher on a tray with some bowls of food and starts for the dining area.
Luke sits with his Uncle Owen before a table covered with steaming bowls of food as Aunt Beru carries in a bowl of red grain.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: You know, I think that R2 unit we bought might have been stolen.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Well, I stumbled across a recording while I was cleaning him.
He says he belongs to someone called Obi-Wan Kenobi.

meta.s: Owen is greatly alarmed at the mention of his name, but manages to control himself.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: I thought he might have meant old Ben.
Do you know what he's talking about?
Well, I wonder if he's related to Ben.

meta.s: Owen breaks loose with a fit of uncontrolled anger.

dialogue.name: OWEN
dialogue.s: That old man's just a crazy old wizard.
Tomorrow I want you to take that R2 unit into Anchorhead and have its memory flushed.
That'll be the end of it.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: But what if this Obi-Wan comes looking for him?

dialogue.name: OWEN
dialogue.s: He won't, I don't think he exists any more.
He died about the same time as your father.

dialogue.name: OWEN
dialogue.s: I told you to forget it.
Your only concern is to prepare the new droids for tomorrow.
In the morning I want them on the south ridge working out those condensers.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: I think those new droids are going to work out fine.
In fact, I, uh, was also thinking about our agreement about my staying on another season.
And if these new droids do work out, I want to transmit my application to the Academy this year.

meta.s: Owen's face becomes a scowl, although he tries to suppress it.

dialogue.name: OWEN
dialogue.s: You mean the next semester before harvest?

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Sure, there're more than enough droids.

dialogue.name: OWEN
dialogue.s: Harvest is when I need you the most.
This year we'll make enough on the harvest so I'll be able to hire some more hands.
And then you can go to the Academy next year.

meta.s: Luke continues to toy with his food, not looking at his uncle.

dialogue.name: OWEN
dialogue.s: You must understand I need you here, Luke.

dialogue.name: OWEN
dialogue.s: Look, it's only one more season.

meta.s: Luke pushes his half-eaten plate of food aside and stands.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Yeah, that's what you said last year when Biggs and Tank left.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: It looks like I'm going nowhere.
I have to finish cleaning those droids.

meta.s: Resigned to his fate, Luke paddles out of the room.
Owen mechanically finishes his dinner.

dialogue.name: AUNT BERU
dialogue.s: Owen, he can't stay here forever.
Most of his friends have gone.
It means so much to him.

dialogue.name: OWEN
dialogue.s: I'll make it up to him next year.

dialogue.name: AUNT BERU
dialogue.s: Luke's just not a farmer, Owen.
He has too much of his father in him.

meta.s: The giant twin suns of Tatooine slowly disappear behind a distant dune range.
Luke stands watching them for a few moments, then reluctantly enters the doomed entrance to the homestead.
Luke enters the garage to discover the robots nowhere in sight.
He takes a small control box from his utility belt similar to the one the Jawas were carrying.
He activates the box, which creates a low hum, and Threepio, letting out a short yell, pops up from behind the Skyhopper spaceship.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: What are you doing hiding there?

meta.s: Threepio stumbles forward, but Artoo is still nowhere in sight.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: I told him not to go, but he's faulty, malfunctioning; kept babbling on about his mission.

meta.s: Luke races out of the garage followed by Threepio.
Luke rushes out of the small doomed entry to the homestead and searches the darkening horizon for the small triped astro- robot.
Threepio struggles out of the homestead and on the salt flat as Luke scans the landscape with his electrobinoculars.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: That R2 unit has always been a problem.
These astro-droids are getting quite out of hand.
Even I can't understand their logic at times.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: How could I be so stupid?

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: Pardon me, sir, but couldn't we go after him?

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: It's too dangerous with all the Sandpeople around.
We'll have to wait until morning.

meta.s: Owen yells up from the homestead plaza.

dialogue.name: OWEN
dialogue.s: Luke, I'm shutting the power down for the night.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: All right, I'll be there in a few minutes.
Boy, am I gonna get it.

meta.s: He takes one final look across the dim horizon.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: You know that little droid is going to cause me a lot of trouble.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: Oh, he excels at that, sir.

meta.s: Morning slowly creeps into the sparse but sparkling oasis of the open courtyard.
The idyll is broken be the yelling of Uncle Owen, his voice echoing throughout the homestead.

dialogue.name: OWEN
dialogue.s: Where could he be loafing now!

meta.s: The interior of the kitchen is a worm glow as Aunt Beru prepares the morning breakfast.
Owen enters in a huff.

dialogue.name: OWEN
dialogue.s: Have you seen Luke this morning?

dialogue.name: AUNT BERU
dialogue.s: He said he had some things to do before he started today, so he left early.

dialogue.name: OWEN
dialogue.s: Did he take those two new droids with him?

dialogue.name: OWEN
dialogue.s: Well, he'd better have those units in the south range repaired be midday or there'll be hell to pay!

scene.sceneheader: EXT. TATOOINE - DESERT WASTELAND - LUKE'S SPEEDER - DAY

meta.s: The rock and sand of the desert floor are a blur as Threepio pilots the sleek Landspeeder gracefully across the vast wasteland.

scene.sceneheader: INT./EXT. LUKE'S SPEEDER - DESERT WASTELAND - TRAVELING -

meta.s: Luke leans over the back of the speeder and adjusts something in the motor compartment.
Threepio signals that is fine and Luke turns back into the wind-whipped cockpit and pops the canopy shut.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Old Ben Kenobi lives out in this direction somewhere, but I don't see how that R2 unit could have come this far.
Uncle Owen isn't going to take this very well.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: Sir, would it help if you told him it was my fault.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: He'd probably only deactivate you for a day or so...

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: Well, on the other hand if you hadn't removed his restraining bolt...

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Wait, there's something dead ahead on the scanner.
It looks like our droid... hit the accelerator.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. TATOOINE - ROCK MESA - DUNE SEA - COASTLINE - DAY

meta.s: From high on a rock mesa, the tiny Landspeeder can be seen gliding across the desert floor.
Suddenly in the foreground two weather-beaten Sandpeople shrouded in their grimy desert cloaks peer over the edge of the rock mesa.
One of the marginally human creatures raises a long ominous laser rifle and points it at the speeder but the second creature grabs the gun before it can be fired.
The Sandpeople, or Tusken Raiders as they're sometimes called, speak in a coarse barbaric language as they get into an animated argument.
The second Tusken Raider seems to get in the final word and the nomads scurry over the rocky terrain.
The Tusken Raider approaches two large Banthas standing tied to a rock.
The monstrous, bear-like creatures are as large as elephants, with huge red eyes, tremendous looped horns, and long, furry, dinosaur-like tails.
The Tusken Raiders mount saddles strapped to the huge creatures' shaggy backs and ride off down the rugged bluff.
The speeder is parked on the floor of a massive canyon.
Luke, with his long laser rifle slung over his shoulder, stands before little Artoo.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Hey, whoa, just where do you think you're going?

meta.s: The little droid whistles a feeble reply, as Threepio poses menacingly behind the little runaway.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: Master Luke here is your rightful owner.
We'll have no more of this Obi-Wan Kenobi jibberish... and don't talk to me about your mission, either.
You're fortunate he doesn't blast you into a million pieces right here.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: I only hope we can get back before Uncle Owen really blows up.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: If you don't mind my saying so, sir, I think you should deactivate the little fugitive until you've gotten him back to your workshop.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: No, he's not going to try anything.

meta.s: Suddenly the little robot jumps to life with a mass of frantic whistles and screams.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: Oh my... sir, he says there are several creatures approaching from the southeast.

meta.s: Luke swings his rifle into position and looks to the south.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Come on, let's have a look.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. TATOOINE - ROCK CANYON - RIDGE - DAY

meta.s: Luke carefully makes his way to the top of a rock ridge and scans the canyon with his electrobinoculars.
He spots the two riderless Banthas.
Threepio struggles up behind the young adventurer.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: There are two Banthas down there but I don't see any... wait a second, they're Sandpeople all right.
I can see one of them now.

meta.s: Luke watches the distant Tusken Raider through his electrobinoculars.
Suddenly something huge moves in front of his field of view.
Before Luke or Threepio can react, a large, gruesome Tusken Raider looms over them.
Threepio is startled and backs away, right off the side if the cliff.
He can be heard for several moments as he clangs, bangs and rattles down the side of the mountain.
The towering creature brings down his curved, double-pointed gaderffii -- the dreaded axe blade that has struck terror in the heart of the local settlers.
But Luke manages to block the blow with his laser rifle, which is smashed to pieces.
The terrified farm boy scrambles backward until he is forced to the edge of a deep crevice.
The sinister Raider stands over him with his weapon raised and lets out a horrible shrieking laugh.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. TATOOINE - ROCK CANYON - FLOOR - DAY

meta.s: Artoo forces himself into the shadows of a small alcove in the rocks as the vicious Sandpeople walk past carrying the inert Luke Skywalker, who is dropped in a heap before the speeder.
The Sandpeople ransack the speeder, throwing parts and supplies in all directions.
Suddenly they stop.
Then everything is quiet for a few moments.
A great howling moan is heard echoing throughout the canyon which sends the Sandpeople fleeing in terror.
Artoo moves even tighter into the shadows as the slight swishing sound that frightened off the Sandpeople grows even closer, until a shabby old desert-rat-of-a-man appears and leans over Luke.
His ancient leathery face, cracked and weathered by exotic climates is set off by dark, penetrating eyes and a scraggly white beard.
Ben Kenobi squints his eyes as he scrutinizes the unconscious farm boy.
Artoo makes a slight sound and Ben turns and looks right at him.
Artoo waddles over to were Luke lies crumpled in a heap and begins to whistle and beep his concern.
Ben puts his hand on Luke's forehead and he begins to come around.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: Don't worry, he'll be all right.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: Rest easy, son, you've had a busy day.
You're fortunate you're still in one piece.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Boy, am I glad to see you!

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: The Jundland wastes are not to be traveled lightly.
Tell me young Luke, what brings you out this far?

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: I think he's searching for his former master...
I've never seen such devotion in a droid before... there seems to be no stopping him.
He claims to be the property of an Obi-Wan Kenobi.
Is he a relative of yours?
Do you know who he's talking about?

meta.s: Ben ponders this for a moment, scratching his scruffy beard.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: Now thats a name I haven't heard in a long time... a long time.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: I think my uncle knew him.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: Oh, he's not dead, not... not yet.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: Well of course, of course I know him.
I haven't gone by the name Obi-Wan since oh, before you were born.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Then the droid does belong to you.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: Don't seem to remember ever owning a droid.

meta.s: He suddenly looks up at the overhanging cliffs.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: I think we better get indoors.
The Sandpeople are easily startled but they will soon be back and in greater numbers.

meta.s: Luke sits up and rubs his head.
Artoo lets out a pathetic beep causing Luke to remember something.
He looks around.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. TATOOINE - SAND PIT - ROCK MESA - DAY

meta.s: Little Artoo stands at the edge of a large sand pit and begins to chatter away in electronic whistles and beeps.
Luke and Ben stand over a very dented and tangled Threepio lying half buried in the sand.
One of his arms has broken off.
Luke tries to revive the inert robot by shaking him and then flips a hidden switch on his back several times until finally the mechanical man's systems turn on.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: I must have taken a bad step...

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: We've got to get out of here before the Sandpeople return.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: I don't think I can make it.
There's no sense in you risking yourself on my account.

meta.s: Artoo makes a beeping sound.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: What kind of talk is that?

meta.s: Luke and Ben help the battered robot to his feet.
Little Artoo watches from the top of the pit.
Ben glances around suspiciously.
Sensing something, he stands up and sniffs the air.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: Quickly, son... they're on the move.

meta.s: The small, spartan hovel is cluttered with desert junk but still manages to radiate an air of time-worn comfort and security.
Luke is in one corner repairing Threepio's arm, as old Ben sits thinking.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: No, my father didn't fight in the wars.
He was a navigator on a spice freighter.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: That's what your uncle told you.
He didn't hold with your father's ideals.
Thought he should have stayed here and not gotten involved.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: You fought in the Clone Wars?

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: Yes, I was once a Jedi Knight the same as your father.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: He was the best star-pilot in the galaxy, and a cunning warrior.
I understand you've become quite a good pilot yourself.
And he was a good friend.

meta.s: Ben gets up and goes to a chest where he rummages around.
As Luke finishes repairing Threepio and starts to fit the restraining bolt back on, Threepio looks at him nervously.
Luke thinks about the bolt for a moment then puts it on the table.
Ben shuffles up and presents Luke with a short handle with several electronic gadgets attached to it.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: I have something here for you.
Your father wanted you to have this when you were old enough, but your uncle wouldn't allow it.
He feared you might follow old Obi-Wan on some damned-fool idealistic crusade like your father did.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: Sir, if you'll not be needing me, I'll close down for awhile.

meta.s: Ben hands Luke the saber.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: This is the weapon of a Jedi Knight.
Not as clumsy or as random as a blaster.

meta.s: Luke pushes a button on the handle.
A long beam shoots out about four feet and flickers there.
The light plays across the ceiling.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: An elegant weapon for a more civilized time.
For over a thousand generations the Jedi Knights were the guardians of peace and justice in the Old Republic.
Before the dark times, before the Empire.

meta.s: Luke hasn't really been listening.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: A young Jedi named Darth Vader, who was a pupil of mine until he turned to evil, helped the Empire hunt down and destroy the Jedi Knights.
He betrayed and murdered your father.
Now the Jedi are all but extinct.
Vader was seduced by the dark side of the Force.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: Well, the Force is what gives a Jedi his power.
It's an energy field created by all living things.
It surrounds us and penetrates us.

meta.s: Artoo makes beeping sounds.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: Now, let's see if we can't figure out what you are, my little friend.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: I saw part of the message he was...

meta.s: Luke is cut short as the recorded image of the beautiful young Rebel princess is projected from Artoo's face.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: I seem to have found it.

meta.s: Luke stops his work as the lovely girl's image flickers before his eyes.

dialogue.name: LEIA
dialogue.s: General Kenobi, years ago you served my father in the Clone Wars.
Now he begs you to help him in his struggle against the Empire.
I regret that I am unable to present my father's request to you in person, but my ship has fallen under attack and I'm afraid my mission to bring you to Alderaan has failed.
I have placed information vital to the survival of the Rebellion into the memory systems of this R2 unit.
My father will know how to retrieve it.
You must see this droid safely delivered to him on Alderaan.
This is our most desperate hour.
Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi, you're my only hope.

meta.s: There is a little static and the transmission is cut short.
Old Ben leans back and scratches his head.
He silently puffs on a tarnished chrome water pipe.
Luke has stars in his eyes.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: You must learn the ways of the Force if you're to come with me to Alderaan.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: It's late, I'm in for it as it is.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: I'm getting too old for this sort of thing.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: It's not that I like the Empire.
But there's nothing I can do about it right now.
It's such a long way from here.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: How am I ever going to explain this?

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Look, I can take you as far as Anchorhead.
You can get a transport there to Mos Eisley or wherever you're going.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: You must do what you feel is right, of course.

meta.s: An Imperial Stardestroyer heads toward the evil planet-like battle station: the Death Star!
Eight Imperial senators and generals sit around a black conference table.
Imperial stormtroopers stand guard around the room.
Commander Tagge, a young, slimy-looking general, is speaking.

dialogue.name: TAGGE
dialogue.s: Until this battle station is fully operational we are vulnerable.
The Rebel Alliance is too well equipped.
They're more dangerous than you realize.

meta.s: The bitter Admiral Motti twists nervously in his chair.

dialogue.name: MOTTI
dialogue.s: Dangerous to your starfleet, Commander, not to this battle station!

dialogue.name: TAGGE
dialogue.s: The Rebellion will continue to gain a support in the Imperial Senate as long as....

meta.s: Suddenly all heads turn as Commander Tagge's speech is cut short and the Grand Moff Tarkin, governor of the Imperial outland regions, enters.
He is followed by his powerful ally, The Sith Lord, Darth Vader.
All of the generals stand and bow before the thin, evil-looking governor as he takes his place at the head of the table.
The Dark Lord stands behind him.

dialogue.name: TARKIN
dialogue.s: The Imperial Senate will no longer be of any concern to us.
I've just received word that the Emperor has dissolved the council permanently.
The last remnants of the Old Republic have been swept away.

dialogue.name: TAGGE
dialogue.s: How will the Emperor maintain control without the bureaucracy?

dialogue.name: TARKIN
dialogue.s: The regional governors now have direct control over territories.
Fear will keep the local systems in line.

dialogue.name: TAGGE
dialogue.s: If the Rebels have obtained a complete technical readout of this station, it is possible, however unlikely, that they might find a weakness and exploit it.

dialogue.name: VADER
dialogue.s: The plans you refer to will soon be back in our hands.

dialogue.name: MOTTI
dialogue.s: Any attack made by the Rebels against this station would be a useless gesture, no matter what technical data they've obtained.
This station is now the ultimate power in the universe.

dialogue.name: VADER
dialogue.s: Don't be too proud of this technological terror you've constructed.
The ability to destroy a planet is insignificant next to the power of the Force.

dialogue.name: MOTTI
dialogue.s: Don't try to frighten us with your sorcerer's ways, Lord Vader.
Your sad devotion to that ancient religion has not helped you conjure up the stolen data tapes, or given you clairvoyance enough to find the Rebel's hidden fort...

meta.s: Suddenly Motti chokes and starts to turn blue under Vader's spell.

dialogue.name: VADER
dialogue.s: I find your lack of faith disturbing.

dialogue.name: TARKIN
dialogue.s: Lord Vader will provide us with the location of the Rebel fortress by the time this station is operational.
We will then crush the Rebellion with one swift stroke.

meta.s: The speeder stops before what remains of the huge Jawas Sandcrawler.
Luke and Ben walk among the smoldering rubble and scattered bodies.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: It looks like Sandpeople did this, all right.
Look, here are Gaffi sticks, Bantha tracks.
I never heard of them hitting anything this big before.

meta.s: Ben is crouching in the sand studying the tracks.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: But we are meant to think they did.
These tracks are side by side.
Sandpeople always ride single file to hide there numbers.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: These are the same Jawas that sold us Artoo and Threepio.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: And these blast points, too accurate for Sandpeople.
Only Imperial stormtroopers are so precise.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Why would Imperial troops want to slaughter Jawas?

meta.s: Luke looks back at the speeder where Artoo and Threepio are inspecting the dead Jawas, and put two and two together.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: If they traced the robots here, they may have learned who they sold them to.
And that would lead them home!

meta.s: Luke reaches a sudden horrible realization, then races for the speeder and jumps it.
Luke races off leaving Ben and the two robots alone with the burning Sandcrawler.
Luke races across the wasteland in his battered Landspeeder.
The speeder roars up to the burning homestead.
Luke jumps out and runs to the smoking holes that were once his home.
Debris is scattered everywhere and it looks as if a great battle has taken place.
Luke stumbles around in a daze looking for his aunt and uncle.
Suddenly he comes upon their smoldering remains.
He is stunned, and cannot speak.
Hate replaces fear and a new resolve comes over him.
Imperial TIE fighter races toward the Death Star.
Two stormtroopers open an electronic cell door and allow several Imperial guards to enter.
Princess Leia's face is filled with defiance, which slowly gives way to fear as a giant black torture robot enters, followed by Darth Vader.

dialogue.name: VADER
dialogue.s: And, now Your Highness, we will discuss the location of your hidden Rebel base.

meta.s: The torture robot gives off a steady beeping sound as it approaches Princess Leia and extends one of its mechanical arms bearing a large hypodermic needle.
The door slides shut and the long cell block hallway appears peaceful.
The muffled screams of the Rebel princess are barely heard.
There is a large bonfire of Jawa bodies blazing in front of the Sandcrawler as Ben and the robots finish burning the dead.
Luke drives up in the speeder and Ben walks over to him.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: There's nothing you could have done, Luke, had you been there.
You'd have been killed, too, and the droids would be in the hands of the Empire.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: I want to come with you to Alderaan.
There's nothing here for me now.
I want to learn the ways of the Force and become a Jedi like my father.

meta.s: The Landspeeder with Luke, Artoo, Threepio, and Ben in it zooms across the desert.
The speeder stops on a bluff overlooking the spaceport at Mos Eisley.
It is a haphazard array of low, grey, concrete structures and semi-domes.
A harsh gale blows across the stark canyon floor.
Luke adjusts his goggles and walks to the edge of the craggy bluff where Ben is standing.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: You will never find a more wretched hive of scum and villainy.

meta.s: Ben looks over at Luke, who gives the old Jedi a determined smile.
The speeder is stopped on a crowded street by several combat- hardend stormtroopers who look over the two robots.
A Trooper questions Luke.

dialogue.name: TROOPER
dialogue.s: How long have you had these droids?

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: They're for sale if you want them.

meta.s: Luke becomes very nervous as he fumbles to find his ID while Ben speaks to the Trooper in a very controlled voice.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: You don't need to see his identification.

dialogue.name: TROOPER
dialogue.s: We don't need to see his identification.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: These are not the droids your looking for.

dialogue.name: TROOPER
dialogue.s: These are not the droids we're looking for.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: He can go about his business.

dialogue.name: TROOPER
dialogue.s: You can go about your business.

meta.s: The speeder pulls up in front of a rundown blockhouse cantina on the outskirts of the spaceport.
Various strange forms of transport, including several unusual beasts of burden, are parked outside the bar.
A Jawa runs up and begins to fondle the speeder.
As Luke gets out of the speeder he tries to shoo the Jawa away.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: I can't understand how we got by those troopers.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: The Force can have a strong influence on the weak-minded.
You will find it a powerful ally.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Do you really think we're going to find a pilot here that'll take us to Alderaan?

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: Well, most of the best freighter pilots can be found here.
This place can be a little rough.

meta.s: The young adventurer and his two mechanical servants follow Ben Kenobi into the smoke-filled cantina.
The murky, moldy den is filled with a startling array of weird and exotic alien creatures and monsters at the long metallic bar.
At first the sight is horrifying.
One-eyed, thousand-eyed, slimy, furry, scaly, tentacled, and clawed creatures huddle over drinks.
Ben moves to an empty spot at the bar near a group of repulsive but human scum.
A huge, rough-looking Bartender stops Luke and the robots.

dialogue.name: BARTENDER
dialogue.s: We don't serve their kind here!

meta.s: Luke still recovering from the shock of seeing so many outlandish creatures, doesn't quite catch the bartender's drift.
Luke looks at old Ben, who is busy talking to one of the Galactic pirates.
He notices several of the gruesome creatures along the bar are giving him a very unfriendly glare.
Luke pats Threepio on the shoulder.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: Listen, why don't you wait out by the speeder.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: I heartily agree with you sir.

meta.s: Threepio and his stubby partner go outside and most of the creatures at the bar go back to their drinks.
Ben is standing next to Chewbacca, an eight-foot-tall savage- looking creature resembling a huge grey bushbaby monkey with fierce baboon-like fangs.
His large blue eyes dominate a fur- covered face and soften his otherwise awesome appearance.
Over his matted, furry body he wears two chrome bandoliers, and little else.
He is a two-hundred-year-old Wookiee and a sight to behold.
Ben speaks to the Wookiee, pointing to Luke several times during his conversation and the huge creature suddenly lets out a horrifying laugh.
Luke is more than a little bit disconcerted and pretends not to hear the conversation between Ben and the giant Wookiee.
Luke is terrified but tries not to show it.
He quietly sips his drink, looking over the crowd for a more sympathetic ear or whatever.
A large, multiple-eyed Creature gives Luke a rough shove.
The hideous freak is obviously drunk.
Luke tries to ignore the creature and turns back on his drink.
A short, grubby Human and an even smaller rodent-like beast join the belligerent monstrosity.
The big creature is getting agitated and yells out some unintelligible gibberish at the now rather nervous, young adventurer.

dialogue.name: HUMAN
dialogue.s: I have the death sentence in twelve systems.

meta.s: The rodent lets out a loud grunt and everything at the bar moves away.
Luke tries to remain cool but it isn't easy.
His three adversaries ready their weapons.
Old Ben moves in behind Luke.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: This little one isn't worth the effort.
Come let me buy you something...

meta.s: A powerful blow from the unpleasant creature sends the young would-be Jedi sailing across the room, crashing through tables and breaking a large jug filled with a foul-looking liquid.
With a blood curdling shriek, the monster draws a wicked chrome laser pistol from his belt and levels it at old Ben.
The bartender panics.
With astounding agility old Ben's laser sword sparks to life and in a flash an arm lies on the floor.
The rodent is cut in two and the giant multiple-eyed creature lies doubled, cut from chin to groin.
Ben carefully and precisely turns off his laser sword and replaces it on his utility belt.
Luke, shaking and totally amazed at the old man's abilities, attempts to stand.
The entire fight has lasted only a matter of seconds.
The cantina goes back to normal, although Ben is given a respectable amount of room at the bar.
Luke, rubbing his bruised head, approaches the old man with new awe.
Ben points the the Wookiee.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: He's first-mate on a ship that might suit our needs.

meta.s: Threepio paces in front of the cantina as Artoo carries on an electronic conversation with another little red astro- droid.
A creature comes out of the cantina and approaches two stormtroopers in the street.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: I don't like the look of this.

meta.s: Strange creatures play exotic big band music on odd-looking instruments as Luke, still giddy, downs a fresh drink and follows Ben and Chewbacca to a booth where Han Solo is sitting.
Han is a tough, roguish starpilot about thirty years old.
A mercenary on a starship, he is simple, sentimental, and cocksure.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: I'm captain of the Millennium Falcon.
Chewie here tells me you're looking for passage to the Alderaan system.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: You've never heard of the Millennium Falcon?

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: It's the ship that made the Kessel run in less than twelve parsecs!

meta.s: Ben reacts to Solo's stupid attempt to impress them with obvious misinformation.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: I've outrun Imperial starships, not the local bulk-cruisers, mind you.
I'm talking about the big Corellian ships now.
She's fast enough for you, old man.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: Myself, the boy, two droids, and no questions asked.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: Let's just say we'd like to avoid any Imperial entanglements.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: Well, that's the trick, isn't it?
And it's going to cost you something extra.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: We could almost buy our own ship for that!

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: But who's going to fly it, kid!

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: I'm not such a bad pilot myself!
We don't have to sit here and listen...

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: We haven't that much with us.
But we could pay you two thousand now, plus fifteen when we reach Alderaan.

meta.s: Han ponders this for a few moments.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: You guys got yourself a ship.
We'll leave as soon as you're ready.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: Looks like somebody's beginning to take an interest in your handiwork.

meta.s: Ben and Luke turn around to see four Imperial stormtroopers looking at the dead bodies and asking the bartenders some questions.
The bartender points to the booth.

dialogue.name: TROOPER
dialogue.s: All right, we'll check it out.

meta.s: The stormtroopers look over at the booth but Luke and Ben are gone.
The bartender shrugs his shoulders in puzzlement.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: Those guys must really be desperate.
This could really save my neck.
Get back to the ship and get her ready.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: You'll have to sell your speeder.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: I'm never coming back to this planet again.

meta.s: As Han is about to leave, Greedo, a slimy green-faced alien with a short trunk-nose, pokes a gun in his side.
The creature speaks in a foreign tongue translated into English subtitles.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: As a matter of fact, I was just going to see your boss.
Tell Jabba that I've got his money.

meta.s: Han sits down and the alien sits across from him holding the gun on him.

dialogue.name: GREEDO
dialogue.s: You should have paid him when you had the chance.
Jabba's put a price on your head, so large that every bounty hunter in the galaxy will be looking for you.
I'm lucky I found you first.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: Yeah, but this time I got the money.

dialogue.name: GREEDO
dialogue.s: If you give it to me, I might forget I found you.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: I don't have it with me.

dialogue.name: GREEDO
dialogue.s: He has no time for smugglers who drop their shipments at the first sign of an Imperial cruiser.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: Do you think I had a choice?

meta.s: Han Solo slowly reaches for his gun under the table.

dialogue.name: GREEDO
dialogue.s: You can tell that to Jabba.
He may only take your ship.

dialogue.name: GREEDO
dialogue.s: I've been looking forward to killing you for a long time.

meta.s: Suddenly the slimy alien disappears in a blinding flash of light.
Han pulls his smoking gun from beneath the table as the other patron look on in bemused amazement.
Han gets up and starts out of the cantina, flipping the bartender some coins as he leaves.
Several TIE fighters approach the Death Star.

dialogue.name: VADER
dialogue.s: Her resistance to the mind probe is considerable.
It will be some time before we can extract any information from her.

meta.s: An Imperial Officer interrupts the meeting.

dialogue.name: TARKIN
dialogue.s: Perhaps she would respond to an alternative form of persuasion.

dialogue.name: TARKIN
dialogue.s: I think it is time we demonstrate the full power of this station.
(to soldier) Set your course for Princess Leia's home planet of Alderaan.

meta.s: Four heavily-armed stormtroopers move menacingly along a narrow slum alleyway crowed with darkly clad creatures hawking exotic goods in the dingy little stalls.
Men, monsters, and robots crouch in the waste-filled doorways, whispering and hiding from the hot winds.
One of the troopers checks a tightly locked door and moves on down the alleyway.
The door slides open a crack and Threepio peeks out.
Artoo is barely visible in the background.

dialogue.name: TROOPER
dialogue.s: All right, check that side of the street.
Move on to the next door.

meta.s: The door opens, Threepio moves into the doorway.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: I would much rather have gone with Master Luke than stay here with you.
I don't know what all the trouble is about, but I'm sure it must be your fault.

meta.s: Artoo makes beeping sounds.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. TATOOINE - MOS EISLEY - STREET - ALLEYWAY - USED

meta.s: Ben and Luke are standing in a sleazy used speeder lot, talking with a tall, grotesque, insect-like used speeder dealer.
Strange exotic bodies and spindly-legged beasts pass by as the insect concludes the sale by giving Luke some coins.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: He says it's the best he can do.
Since the XP-38 came out, they're just not in demand.

meta.s: Ben and Luke leave the speeder lot and walk down the dusty alleyway past a small robot herding a bunch of anteater-like creatures.
Luke turns and gives one last forlorn look at his faithful speeder as he rounds a corner.
A darkly clad creature moves out of the shadows as they pass and watches them as they disappear down another alley.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: If the ship's as fast as he's boasting, we ought to do well.

meta.s: Jabba the Hut and a half-dozen grisly alien pirates and purple creatures stand in the middle of the docking bay.
Jabba is the grossest of the slavering hulks and his scarred face is a grim testimonial to his prowess as a vicious killer.
He is a fat, slug-like creature with eyes on extended feelers and a huge ugly mouth.
A voice from directly behind the pirates startles them and they turn around to see Han Solo and the giant Wookiee, Chewbacca, standing behind them with no weapons in sight.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: I've been waiting for you, Jabba.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: I'm not the type to run.

dialogue.name: JABBA
dialogue.s: (fatherly-smooth) Han, my boy, there are times when you disappoint me... why haven't you paid me?
And why did you have to fry poor Greedo like that... after all we've been through together.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: You sent Greedo to blast me.

dialogue.name: JABBA
dialogue.s: (mock surprise) Han, why you're the best smuggler in the business.
He was only relaying my concern at your delays.
He wasn't going to blast you.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: I think he thought he was.
Next time don't send one of those twerps.
If you've got something to say to me, come see me yourself.

dialogue.name: JABBA
dialogue.s: If only you hadn't had to dump that shipment of spice... you understand I just can't make an exception.
Where would I be if every pilot who smuggled for me dumped their shipment at the first sign of an Imperial starship?

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: You know, even I get boarded sometimes, Jabba.
I had no choice, but I've got a charter now and I can pay you back, plus a little extra.
I just need some more time.

dialogue.name: JABBA
dialogue.s: (to his men) Put your blasters away.
Han, my boy, I'm only doing this because you're the best and I need you.
So, for an extra, say twenty percent I'll give you a little more time... but this is it.
If you disappoint me again, I'll put a price on your head so large you won't be able to go near a civilized system for the rest of your short life.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: Jabba, I'll pay you because it's my pleasure.

meta.s: Chewbacca waits restlessly at the entrance to Docking Bay 94.
Ben, Luke, and the robots make their way up the street.
Chewbacca jabbers excitedly and signals for them to hurry.
The darkly clad creature has followed them from the speeder lot.
He stops in a nearby doorway and speaks into a small transmitter.

scene.sceneheader: INT. MOS EISLEY SPACEPORT - DOCKING BAY 94

meta.s: Chewbacca leads the group into a giant dirt pit that is Docking Bay 94.
Resting in the middle of the huge hole is a large, round, beat-up, pieced-together hunk of junk that could only loosely be called a starship.
The tall figure of Han Solo comes down the boarding ramp.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: She'll make point five beyond the speed of light.
She may not look like much, but she's got it where it counts, kid.
I've added some special modifications myself.

meta.s: Luke scratches his head.
It's obvious he isn't sure about all this.
Chewbacca rushes up the ramp and urges the others to follow.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: We're a little rushed, so if you'll hurry aboard we'll get out of here.

meta.s: The group rushes up the gang plank, passing a grinning Han Solo.
Chewbacca settles into the pilot's chair and starts the mighty engines of the starship.

scene.sceneheader: INT. MOS EISLEY SPACEPORT - DOCKING BAY 94

meta.s: Luke, Ben, Threepio, and Artoo move toward the Millennium Falcon passing Solo.
Eight Imperial stormtroopers rush up to the darkly clad creature.
The darkly clad creature points to the door of the docking bay.

scene.sceneheader: INT. MOS EISLEY SPACEPORT - DOCKING BAY 94]

meta.s: The troops hold their guns at the ready and charge down the docking bay entrance.
Han Solo looks up and sees the Imperial stormtroopers rushing into the docking bay.
Several of the troopers fire at Han as he ducks into the spaceship.
Han draws his laser pistol and pops off a couple of shots which force the stormtroopers to dive for safety.
The pirateship engines whine as Han hits the release button that slams the overhead entry shut.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: Chewie, get us out of here!

meta.s: The group straps in for take off.

dialogue.name: THREEPIO
dialogue.s: I'd forgotten how much I hate space travel.

meta.s: The half-dozen stormtroopers at a check point hear the general alarm and look to the sky as the huge starship rises above the dingy slum dwellings and quickly disappears into the morning sky.
Han climbs into the pilot's chair next to Chewbacca, who chatters away as he points to something on the radar scope.
The Corellian pirateship zooms from Tatooine into space.
Han frantically types information into the ship's computer.
Little Artoo appears momentarily at the cockpit doorway, makes a few beeping remarks, then scurries away.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: It looks like an Imperial cruiser.
Our passengers must be hotter than I thought.
Angle the deflector shield while I make the calculations for the jump to light speed.

meta.s: The Millennium Falcon pirateship races away from the yellow planet, Tatooine.
It is followed by two huge Imperial stardestroyers.
Over the shoulders of Chewbacca and Han, we can see the galaxy spread before them.
Luke and Ben make their way into the cramped cockpit where Han continues his calculation.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: There are two more coming in; they're going to try to cut us off.

dialogue.name: LUKE
dialogue.s: I thought you said this thing was fast.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: Watch your mouth, kid, or you're going to find yourself floating home.
We'll be safe enough once we make the jump to hyperspace.
Besides, I know a few maneuvers.

meta.s: Imperial cruisers fire at the pirateship.
The ship shudders as an explosion flashes outside the window.

dialogue.name: BEN
dialogue.s: How long before you can make the jump to light speed?

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: It'll take a few moments to get the coordinates from the navi-computer.

meta.s: The ship begins to rock violently as lasers hit it.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: Traveling through hyperspace isn't like dusting crops, boy!
Without precise calculations we could fly right through a star or bounce too close to a supernova and that'd end your trip real quick, wouldn't it?

meta.s: The ship is now constantly battered with laserfire as a red warning light begins to flash.

dialogue.name: HAN
dialogue.s: Go strap yourself in, I'm going to make the jump to light speed.

meta.s: The galaxy brightens and they move faster, almost as if crashing a barrier.
Stars become streaks as the pirateship makes the jump to hyperspace.
The Millennium Falcon zooms into infinity in less than a second.
Alderaan looms behind the Death Star battlestation.
Admiral Motti enters the quiet control room and bows before Governor Tarkin, who stands before the huge wall screen displaying a small green planet.
Vader and two stormtroopers enter with Princess Leia.
Her hands are bound.

dialogue.name: LEIA
dialogue.s: Governor Tarkin, I should have expected to find you holding Vader's leash.
I recognized your foul stench when I was brought on board.

dialogue.name: TARKIN
dialogue.s: You don't know how hard I found it signing the order to terminate your life!

dialogue.name: LEIA
dialogue.s: I surprised you had the courage to take the responsibility yourself!

dialogue.name: TARKIN
dialogue.s: Princess Leia, before your execution I would like you to be my guest at a ceremony that will make this battle station operational.
No star system will dare oppose the Emperor now.

dialogue.name: LEIA
